It feels like a natural sequel to the first game by giving us the chance to know the characters in ways that we never did in the first game. There are so many tiny little story details and nuances that add up to these characters that I'm still finding new stuff on my third playthrough\, and the characters keep looking more and more like real people\, with real struggles and believable relationships. More than anything\, this is a game that wasn't afraid to be what it is\, the story is harsh\, heavy\, difficult to swallow\, everything done with masterpiece level of videogame craftsmanship to support the uniqueness of this narrative. I have found answers to every 'plot hole' I read on the internet by just paying close attention to the game. I hope with time people will understand that there's so much more here storywise than the eye meets at first glance\, and that great stories are sometimes great sad stories.
